title: Readers Share the One Thing That Got Them Through the Pandemic Year
sub_head: Wall Street Journal readers write about where they found solace during the past year
body:
A recent Wall Street Journal article by Anne Marie Chaker detailed how different people across the U.S. have found comfort during the coronavirus pandemic. Many people have used the past year to realize longtime goals while others have taken on new activities.
Readers wrote in to share their own experiences during the past year. Here are some edited excerpts.
—Xavier Cousens
I wrote my first children’s book, memorializing a story that my dad made up to tell the grandchildren about a troll named Beano. It is being illustrated now and is due to be published by summer.
Lisa Lovvorn, Frisco, Texas
